intro: Richterago arenaria, commonly known as the sand sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to sandy soils in temperate regions. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish or brownish flowers in spike-like clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or gravelly habitats and is often found in coastal or inland dunes. Richterago arenaria plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity.
